alert.note: Alert for Adams; Allen; Huntington; Wells; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 3:15PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Allen, Whitley, northern Huntington, northeastern Wells and northern Adams Counties through 400 PM EST... At 314 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South Whitley to Markle to 6 miles north of Montpelier. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, Huntington, New Haven, Columbia City, Ossian, Tri-lakes, Huntertown, Churubusco, South Whitley, Woodburn, Monroeville, Grabill, Aboite, Leo-cedarville, Middletown, Roanoke, Zanesville, Dixon, Yoder and Blue Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 288 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for northeastern Indiana...and west central Ohio.
